comments.body: hmm, I think this is a significant change, can you explain?

s1.index -> RangeIndex(start=0, stop=3, step=1)
s2.index -> Index([], dtype='object')

the implicit union called in concat is casting to dtype('O') since these index types are incompatible and empty indexes are no longer ignored (at least before indexes are cast to object)

comments.body: This feels pretty specific to Int64, so I might have placed in in `pandas/tests/arrays/integer`, but this works too.
this is testing pd.concat directly; i think this is a reasonable place for this test.

Yes, it is testing specifically that EAs in frames take the correct concat code path. I could also have used another EA such boolean or string. So this is frame specific.

The actual concat logic (Int64 + int64 -> Int64, Int64 + float64 -> float64, etc) is tested in `tests/arrays/integer/test_concat.py`, and doesn't need to involve frames in principle, as long as we test elsewhere (here) that frames take the EA concatting code path.
